info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 8:34PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Arapahoe, southern Broomfield, Denver, northeastern Jefferson and western Adams Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 829 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms over north to northwest Denver, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, frequent lightning and brief heavy rainfall, from 0.25 to 0.50 inches in less than 30 minuted. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Denver, Aurora, Lakewood, Thornton, Arvada, Westminster, Centennial, Broomfield, Commerce City, Littleton, Northglenn, Brighton, Englewood, Wheat Ridge, Greenwood Village, Federal Heights, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, Sheridan and Arapahoe Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
